lines.text:
Oh you didn't think the meta
of speaking directly to you in game
ended at the intro, did you?

Nope, it's 4th wall breaking
all the way BAY-BEE!

Outside are some interactables
that will tell you a bit more of the
project details.

Why don't you start by telling
Pippin a bit more about the
dialog system?

Hey yeah!

Thanks, whatever your name is!.

Wh-

I'M THE MAIN CHARACTER OF THE GAME!

Yeah well this is a tech demo
so it's my show now, assshole.

The dialog system features 2
consistent images, 3 image slots,
and 2 text fields.

The consistent images are the
overlay behind me, and the text box
used below.

As for the slot system, the area
behind the textbox is zoned into
3 sections from slot0 to slot2.

This allows us to call up player
portraits or other image resources
when needed!

With the text field, there is
a section for a name and then the
text that follows.

All of this is managed through
string input from JSON files.

Here you can see 2 slots are called
up, the actors name is defined
as Virgil, and the text field
is for the main text box.

Just don't forget to do the
formatting correctly or you'll
have to deal with this stupid
error.

Mads is still working on creating
animation and better image
controls, but for now this system
works pretty well.

At the very least, it allows me
to berate everyone when I need to.

CHLOE!

AH! Ok! Fine yes we're going.

Jesus, man...
